skill.name: umap-learn
skill.description: UMAP dimensionality reduction. Fast nonlinear manifold learning for 2D/3D visualization, clustering preprocessing (HDBSCAN), supervised/parametric UMAP, for high-dimensional data.
skill.summary: UMAP dimensionality reduction. Fast nonlinear manifold learning for 2D/3D visualization, clustering ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains documentation and example usage only. No file access, network calls, or executable logic is present. No malicious patterns were detected.

content.value_statement: You need clear guidance to tune UMAP for visualization and clustering. This skill gives practical parameter advice and workflows.
actual_capabilities: Explain UMAP parameter roles and tuning ranges
Provide preprocessing guidance such as feature scaling
Describe supervised and semi-supervised UMAP usage
Outline clustering workflows with UMAP and HDBSCAN
Cover Parametric UMAP and DensMAP options
limitations: Does not execute code or install packages
Cannot validate results without your data and metrics
Transform quality may degrade when data distributions differ

use_cases.title: Explore high dimensional data
use_cases.description: Tune UMAP for 2D or 3D visualization and understand tradeoffs.

use_cases.title: Build clustering pipelines
use_cases.description: Configure UMAP for density friendly embeddings before HDBSCAN.

use_cases.title: Compare labeled groups
use_cases.description: Apply supervised UMAP to separate classes while preserving structure.

prompt_templates.title: UMAP basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain UMAP in simple terms and give a safe default parameter set for a 2D visualization.

prompt_templates.title: Tune for clustering
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend UMAP settings for clustering preprocessing and explain why n_neighbors, min_dist, and n_components matter.

prompt_templates.title: Supervised embedding
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to run supervised UMAP with labels and note the key benefits and risks.

prompt_templates.title: Parametric UMAP plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline when to use Parametric UMAP, required dependencies, and a minimal training setup.

output_examples.input: Give me a UMAP configuration for clustering and explain the choices.
output: Use n_neighbors around 30 to capture broader structure.
Set min_dist to 0.0 to pack clusters tightly.
Choose n_components between 5 and 10 for better density preservation.
Keep metric as euclidean unless your data needs cosine or hamming.

best_practices: Use different UMAP settings for clustering and visualization
anti_patterns: Comparing runs without a fixed random_state

faq.question: Is this compatible with scikit-learn pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. UMAP follows scikit-learn conventions and works in pipelines.

faq.question: What limits should I expect on large datasets?
faq.answer: Performance can slow on large datasets. Consider PCA first or low_memory settings.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with HDBSCAN?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill outlines parameter choices for UMAP plus HDBSCAN workflows.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data or files?
faq.answer: No. It only provides guidance and does not read or transmit data.

faq.question: Why do my transforms look different from training?
faq.answer: Transform quality drops when new data distributions differ from training data.

faq.question: How does it compare with t-SNE?
faq.answer: UMAP is faster, scales better, and supports transforms and supervised variants.
